td.p:
Have there been any demographic changes? (ex. contact information)
(complete the Change in Demographics form)

tr.td: Does the patient have any of the following danger signs?
Problems breathing with chest indrawing, rapid breathing, stridor
Rigid muscles or jaw clenching that prevents feeding

Normal Temperature for age:
*Infant <2 months: between 35.5 and 37.5°C.
*Age 2-59 months: ≤ 37.5 °C

td.p: Is temperature abnormal for age range?

tr.td:
Normal Respiratory Rates for age:
*Infant <2 months: <60 breaths per minute
*Infant 2-12 months: <50 breaths per minute
*Child 1-5 years: < 40 breaths per minute

td.p: Is respiratory rate abnormal for age range?

tr.td:
Corrected Age (if GA
<37 weeks and <2
years old)
(weeks) *Note: If possible, use this age for determining z-scores below

td.p:
What is the child feeding?
If breastmilk,
td.label: Is the child being fed appropriately for age? ☐ Yes ☐ No If no, specify what is not being done:

td.span:
Does the child have a feeding difficulty?
If mild/moderate/severe,specify:
Have you made changes to the child’s food/liquid consistency? ☐ No ☐ Yes If yes, ☐ Altered food consistency ☐ Altered liquid consistency ☐ Other:__________________
td.p:
• <6 months, go to Infants <6 Months Feeding Assessment (breastfed or non-breastfed infant) job aid and document on PDC Standard Visit Flow Sheet
• >=6 months, go to 6-59 Months General Child Feeding Assessment job aid and document on PDC Standard Visit Flow Sheet
• >=6 months, conduct 6-59 Child Feeding Difficulty Assessment, if necessary

• <6 months, go to Infants <6 Months Feeding Assessment (breastfed or non-breastfed infant) job aid and document on Acute Malnutrition <6 Months form
• >=6 months, go to 6-59 Months General Child Feeding Assessment job aid and document on document on Growth Failure 6-59 Months form
• >=6 months, conduct 6-59 Child Feeding Difficulty Assessment, if necessary

Does the child require treatment for malnutrition/growth failure in PDC?
